Answer the following questions based on the discussions in class.

Expected Return, Variance, and Standard Deviation of a Portfolio

What is the expected return of a portfolio that invests 37.28% in Asset 1 (expected return = 11.77%) and the remaining 62.72% in Asset 2 (expected return = -4.8% )?

‚úÖ Expected return = w‚ÇÅ√ór‚ÇÅ + w‚ÇÇ√ór‚ÇÇ = 1.38%.

What is the variance of the portfolio above, given correlation 0.52, standard deviation of Asset 1 = 26.42% and of Asset 2 = 18.6%?

‚úÖ Variance = w‚ÇÅ¬≤œÉ‚ÇÅ¬≤ + w‚ÇÇ¬≤œÉ‚ÇÇ¬≤ + 2w‚ÇÅw‚ÇÇœÅœÉ‚ÇÅœÉ‚ÇÇ = 3.51.

What is the standard deviation of the portfolio above?

‚úÖ Standard deviation = ‚àö(variance) = 18.75%.

Portfolio Weight Calculation for Multiple Stocks

Suppose you purchase 239 shares of Company A at $51.97 per share, 180 shares of Company B at $38.62 per share, and 13 shares of Company C at $49.03 per share.

‚úÖ Weight on Company A = value_A / total_value √ó 100 = 62.07%.

Portfolio Variance and Standard Deviation Calculation

You invest 16.75% of your funds in Asset A (volatility = 19.89%) and 83.25% in Asset B (volatility = 24.2%). The correlation between the two assets is 0.25.

‚úÖ Portfolio variance = w¬≤√ósd‚ÇÅ¬≤ + (1‚àíw)¬≤√ósd‚ÇÇ¬≤ + 2√ów√ó(1‚àíw)√ósd‚ÇÅ√ósd‚ÇÇ√óœÅ = 450.49.

‚úÖ Portfolio standard deviation = ‚àö(variance) = 21.22%.

Calculating Beta Using Covariance and Market Variance

Given that the covariance between a stock and the market is 4.32 and the variance of the market is 5.46,

‚úÖ Beta = Cov(asset, market) / Var(market) = 0.79.

Risk Premium and Sharpe Ratio Calculation

An investment has an expected return of 7.65%, a risk‚Äëfree rate of 2.19%, and a volatility (standard deviation) of 16.23%.

‚úÖ Risk premium = expected return ‚àí risk‚Äëfree rate = 5.46%.

‚úÖ Sharpe ratio = risk premium / volatility = 0.34.

Combining Risky Asset and Risk‚ÄëFree Rate

You invest 53.12% of your funds in a risky portfolio (expected return = 11.42%, volatility = 12.52%) and the remainder 46.88% in the risk‚Äëfree asset (rate = 4.29%).

‚úÖ Expected return = w√óret_risky + (1‚àíw)√óRf = 8.08%.

‚úÖ Since the risk‚Äëfree asset has zero volatility, the portfolio‚Äôs volatility equals w√óœÉ_risky = 6.65%.

Beta of a Three‚ÄëAsset Portfolio

You hold a portfolio composed of three assets with betas 0.74, 0.74, and 0.42, invested in proportions 27.74%, 61.14%, and 11.11%, respectively.

‚úÖ Portfolio beta = w‚ÇÅ√óŒ≤‚ÇÅ + w‚ÇÇ√óŒ≤‚ÇÇ + w‚ÇÉ√óŒ≤‚ÇÉ = 0.7.

Expected Return via CAPM

The risk‚Äëfree rate is 3.23%, the market risk premium is 5.07%, and the beta of the investment is 1.11.

‚úÖ Expected return = Rf + Œ≤ √ó (market risk premium) = 8.87%.

Variance and Volatility of a Three‚ÄëAsset Portfolio

You invest 66.03%, 22.94%, and 11.03% of your funds in three assets with volatilities 15.04%, 20.33%, and 20.27%, respectively. The pairwise correlations are œÅ‚ÇÅ‚ÇÇ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ0.56, œÅ‚ÇÅ‚ÇÉ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ0.22, and œÅ‚ÇÇ‚ÇÉ‚ÄØ=‚ÄØ-0.11.

‚úÖ Variance = Œ£w·µ¢¬≤œÉ·µ¢¬≤ + 2Œ£ w·µ¢w‚±ºœÉ·µ¢œÉ‚±ºœÅ·µ¢‚±º = 185.17.

‚úÖ Standard deviation = ‚àö(variance) = 13.61%.

Risk‚ÄëFree Combination and Sharpe Ratio

You build a portfolio by combining the risk‚Äëfree asset (rate = 4.3%) with a tangent portfolio (expected return = 15.27%, volatility = 21.31%) using a weight of 147.85% in the tangent portfolio (weights greater than 100% imply leverage).

‚úÖ Expected return = w√óret_tan + (1‚àíw)√óRf = 20.52%.

‚úÖ Standard deviation = |w|√óœÉ_tan = 31.5%.

‚úÖ Sharpe ratio = risk premium / volatility = 0.52.

Question 11

An investment has an expected return of 10.45%, a risk‚Äëfree rate of 2.19%, and a volatility (standard deviation) of 16.83%.

‚úÖ Risk premium = expected return ‚àí risk‚Äëfree rate = 8.25%.

‚úÖ Sharpe ratio = risk premium / volatility = 0.49.
